section.section: The State Treasurer shall invest surplus money of the Fund in any security in which a savings bank may invest under State law.

If the State Treasurer invests in a certificate of deposit, it shall:
be interest bearing;
be issued by:
a bank located and authorized to do business in the State;
a national banking association located in the State; or
a trust company located and authorized to do business in the State; and
be secured in full by a pledge of a direct obligation of the State or United States.

text.section: If sale of a security in which money of the Fund is invested is in the best interest of the Fund, the State Treasurer may sell the security.
